info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.user
info.description:
This API can be used to manage various attributes of the user like
role, contact information etc.

post.description: In case when user created initially from identity provider we need to sync the user data.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
Username

x-example: "user1@company.com"
This is an optional field meant to be used as username.
Inside Volterra's UAM, email is already treated as user's username
and as best practice, recommendation is to keep this same as email field.
if not specified, this field will be set same as email field.

post.description:
CascadeDelete deletes the user and associated namespace roles for this user.
Use this only if the user and its referenced objects need to be wiped out altogether.
Note: users will always be in the system namespace.

ioschemaEmpty.description: This can be used for messages where no values are needed
ioschemaEmpty.title: Empty

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

schemaAddonServiceAccess.description:
x-displayName: "Addon Service Access"
State of access into service

 - AS_AC_NONE: x-displayName: "None"
default state
This can mean that addon service is not subscribed or is in pending subscription.
 - AS_AC_ALLOWED: x-displayName: "Allow"
access is allowed
 - AS_AC_PBAC_DENY: x-displayName: "PBAC Deny"
Addon service is not allowed as part of current plan
 - AS_AC_PBAC_DENY_UPGRADE_PLAN: x-displayName: "PBAC Deny - Upgrade plan"
Addon service is not allowed as part of current plan. To enable it, user is requested to uprade the plan
 - AS_AC_PBAC_DENY_CONTACT_SALES: x-displayName: "PBAC Deny - Contact Sales"
Addon service is not allowed as part of current plan. To enable or to find out more, user is requested to contact sales
 - AS_AC_PBAC_DENY_AS_AC_EOL: x-displayName: "PBAC Deny - End of  Life"
Addon service is not allowed as part of current plan as it is discontinued. User is requested to contact sales discuss alternatives
schemaAddonServiceAccess.title: AddonServiceAccess

schemaAddonServiceState.description:
x-displayName: "Addon Service State"
State of a service

 - AS_NONE: x-displayName: "None"
default state
 - AS_PENDING: x-displayName: "Pending Subscription"
initiated subscription request and is pending to activate (requested).
 - AS_SUBSCRIBED: x-displayName: "Subscribed"
successfully subscribed
 - AS_ERROR: x-displayName: "Error"
service subscription request ended up in error state.
schemaAddonServiceState.title: AddonServiceState

schemaErrorCode.description:
Union of all possible error-codes from system

 - EOK: No error
 - EPERMS: Permissions error
 - EBADINPUT: Input is not correct
 - ENOTFOUND: Not found
 - EEXISTS: Already exists
 - EUNKNOWN: Unknown/catchall error
 - ESERIALIZE: Error in serializing/de-serializing
 - EINTERNAL: Server error
 - EPARTIAL: Partial error
schemaErrorCode.title: ErrorCode

schemaErrorType.description: Information about a error in API operation
schemaErrorType.title: ErrorType

message.description:
A human readable string of the error

Example: ` "value"`
message.title: message

schemaInitializerType.description: Initializer is information about an initializer that has not yet completed.
schemaInitializerType.title: InitializerType

name.description: name of the service that is responsible for initializing this object.
name.title: name

schemaInitializersType.description: Initializers tracks the progress of initialization of a configuration object
schemaInitializersType.title: InitializersType

pending.description:
Pending is a list of initializers that must execute in order before this object is initialized.
 When the last pending initializer is removed, and no failing result is set, the initializers
 struct will be set to nil and the object is considered as initialized and visible to all
 clients.
pending.title: pending

schemaNamespaceAccessType.description: Access info in the namespaces for the entity
schemaNamespaceAccessType.title: Namespace Access

namespace_role_map.description:
List of all the roles for the entity in the namespaces

Example: ` '<namespace> [<roles>]'`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.max_len: 256
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
namespace_role_map.title: Namespace Role Map

namespace.description:
Namespace the role applies to
 '*' value implies all namespaces

Example: ` "ns1"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256
namespace.title: Namespace

role.description:
Users role for this namespace

Example: ` "ves-io-monitor-role"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.ves_object_name: true
role.title: Role

schemaObjectMetaType.description:
ObjectMetaType is metadata(common attributes) of an object that all configuration objects will have.
The information in this type can be specified by user during create and replace APIs.
schemaObjectMetaType.title: ObjectMetaType

annotations.description:
Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be
 set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not
 queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects.

Example: ` "value"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.max_len: 64
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.min_len: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.values.string.max_len: 1024
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.values.string.min_len: 1
annotations.title: annotations

description.description:
Human readable description for the object

Example: ` "Virtual Host for acmecorp website"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 1200
description.title: description

disable.description:
A value of true will administratively disable the object

Example: ` "true"`
disable.title: disable

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
 (scope and select) objects as chosen by the user. Values specified here will be used
 by selector expression

Example: ` "value"`
labels.title: labels

name.description:
This is the name of configuration object. It has to be unique within the namespace.
 It can only be specified during create API and cannot be changed during replace API.
 The value of name has to follow DNS-1035 format.

Example: ` "acmecorp-web"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
name.title: name

namespace.description:
This defines the workspace within which each the configuration object is to be created.
 Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""

Example: ` "staging"`
namespace.title: namespace

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for this object. Object create will fail if
 provided by the client and the value exists in the system. Typically generated by the
 server on successful creation of an object and is not allowed to change once populated.
 Shadowed by SystemObjectMeta's uid field.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

schemaObjectRefType.description:
This type establishes a 'direct reference' from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred).
Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name for public API and Uid for private API
This type of reference is called direct because the relation is explicit and concrete (as opposed
to selector reference which builds a group based on labels of selectee objects)
schemaObjectRefType.title: ObjectRefType

kind.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then kind will hold the referred object's kind (e.g. "route")

Example: ` "virtual_site"`
kind.title: kind

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contactus-route"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) namespace.

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

tenant.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then tenant will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) tenant.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

uid.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then uid will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) uid.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

schemaPlanType.description: PlanType is the type of billing plan for the customer
schemaPlanType.title: PlanType

names.description:
x-displayName: "Roles List"
x-example: ["ves-io-monitor-role", "ves-io-uam-admin-role"]
x-required
List of all the roles
names.title: Roles List

schemaSignupOrigin.description:
x-required
SignupOrigin indicates, from which platform signup is originated, example f5xc, aws..etc

 - ORIGIN_UNKNOWN: ORIGIN_UNKNOWN

Indicates, the origin of the signup is unknown
 - ORIGIN_F5XC: ORIGIN_F5XC

ORIGIN_F5XC as an origin indicates, signup is initiated from console or by internal scaling/testing/support teams using private API
 - ORIGIN_AWS: ORIGIN_AWS

ORIGIN_AWS as an origin indicates, signup is initiated from AWS marketplace & it comes to eywaprime via tsahik
 - ORIGIN_ASB: ORIGIN_ASB

ORIGIN_ASB as an origin indicates signup originated from Azure service bus provisioning messages & it comes to eywaprime via tsahik
schemaSignupOrigin.title: SignupOrigin

schemaStatusType.description: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.
schemaStatusType.title: StatusType

code.description:
Suggested HTTP return code for this status, 0 if not set.

Example: ` "0"`
code.title: code

reason.description:
A human-readable description of why this operation is in the
 "Failure" status. If this value is empty there
 is no information available.

Example: ` "value"`
reason.title: reason

status.description:
Status of the operation.
 One of: "Success" or "Failure".

Example: ` "value"`
status.title: status

schemaSyncMode.description:
Sync mode is to specify where the user details are being synced from.

 - SELF: Self
System managed user.
 - SCIM: SCIM
SCIM synced user. Full user life cycle is managed by the SCIM provider.
schemaSyncMode.title: Sync Mode

schemaSystemObjectMetaType.description:
SystemObjectMetaType is metadata generated or populated by the system for all persisted objects and
cannot be updated directly by users.
schemaSystemObjectMetaType.title: SystemObjectMetaType

creation_timestamp.description:
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations.
 Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

creator_class.description:
A value identifying the class of the user or service which created this configuration object.

Example: ` "value"`
creator_class.title: creator_class

creator_cookie.description:
This can used by the creator of the object for later audit for e.g. by storing the
 version identifying information of the object so at future it can be determined if
 version present at remote end is current or stale.

Example: ` "value"`
creator_cookie.title: creator_cookie

creator_id.description:
A value identifying the exact user or service that created this configuration object

Example: ` "value"`
creator_id.title: creator_id

deletion_timestamp.description:
DeletionTimestamp is RFC 3339 date and time at which this resource will be deleted. This
 field is set by the server when a graceful deletion is requested by the user, and is not
 directly settable by a client. The resource is expected to be deleted (no longer visible
 from resource lists, and not reachable by name) after the time in this field, once the
 finalizers list is empty. As long as the finalizers list contains items, deletion is blocked.
 Once the deletionTimestamp is set, this value may not be unset or be set further into the
 future, although it may be shortened or the resource may be deleted prior to this time.
 For example, a user may request that a pod is deleted in 30 seconds. The Kubelet will react
 by sending a graceful termination signal to the containers in the pod. After that 30 seconds,
 the Kubelet will send a hard termination signal (SIGKILL) to the container and after cleanup,
 remove the pod from the API. In the presence of network partitions, this object may still
 exist after this timestamp, until an administrator or automated process can determine the
 resource is fully terminated.
 If not set, graceful deletion of the object has not been requested.

 Populated by the system when a graceful deletion is requested.
 Read-only.
deletion_timestamp.title: deletion_timestamp

direct_ref_hash.description:
A hash of the UIDs of  direct references on this object. This can be used to determine if 
 this object hash has had references become resolved/unresolved
direct_ref_hash.title: direct_ref_hash

finalizers.description:
Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry
 is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry
 from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries
 in this list can only be removed.

Example: ` "value"`
finalizers.title: finalizers

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
 (scope and select) objects as chosen by the operator or software. Values here can be interpreted
 by software(backend or frontend) to enable certain behavior e.g. things marked as soft-deleted(restorable).

Example: ` "'ves.io/soft-deleted''true'"`
labels.title: labels

modification_timestamp.description:
ModificationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 last modified.
modification_timestamp.title: modification_timestamp

namespace.description:
The namespace this object belongs to. This is populated by the service based on the
 metadata.namespace field when an object is created.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 1
namespace.title: namespace

object_index.description:
Unique index for the object. Some objects need a unique integer index to be allocated
 for each object type. This field will be populated for all objects that need it and will
 be zero otherwise.

Example: ` "0"`
object_index.title: object_index

revision.description:
A revision number which always increases with each modification of the object in storage
 This doesn't necessarily increase sequentially, but should always increase.
 This will be 0 when first created, and before any modifications.
revision.title: revision

sre_disable.description:
This should be set to true If VES/SRE operator wants to suppress an object from being
 presented to business-logic of a daemon(e.g. due to bad-form/issue-causing Object).
 This is meant only to be used in temporary situations for operational continuity till
 a fix is rolled out in business-logic.

Example: ` "true"`
sre_disable.title: sre_disable

tenant.description:
Tenant to which this configuration object belongs to. The value for this is found from
 presented credentials.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

trace_info.description:
trace_info holds information(<trace-id>:<span-id>:<parent-span-id>) of the request doing
 the object modification. This can be used on the watch side to create subsequent spans.
 This information can be used to co-relate activities across services (modulo state compression)
 for a synchronous API.

Example: ` "value"`
trace_info.title: trace_info

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for this object. It is generated by
 the server on successful creation of an object and is not allowed to change on Replace
 API. The value of is taken from uid field of ObjectMetaType, if provided.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

vtrp_stale.description: Indicate whether mars deems this object to be stale via graceful restart timer information
vtrp_stale.title: vtrp_stale

schemaTenantType.description:
TenantType is the type of the customer

UNKNOWN indicates the field not being set
FREEMIUM are customer that don't have their domain
ENTERPRiISE customer have their domain
schemaTenantType.title: TenantType

schemaTileAccessState.description:
x-displayName: "Tile Access State"
State of access to Primary navigation tile.

 - TILE_AC_NONE: x-displayName: "None"
default state
 - TILE_AC_ALLOWED: x-displayName: "Allowed"
access is allowed
 - TILE_AC_UPGRADE_PLAN: x-displayName: "Upgrade Plan"
Require plan upgrade.
 - TILE_AC_NOT_SUBSCRIBED: x-displayName: "Not Subscribed"
Required Addon Service is not subscribed.
schemaTileAccessState.title: TileAccessState

schemaViewRefType.description: ViewRefType represents a reference to a view
schemaViewRefType.title: ViewRefType

kind.description:
Kind of the view object

Example: ` "http_proxy"`
kind.title: kind

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contactus-route"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) namespace.

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

uid.description:
UID of the view object

Example: ` "f3744323-1adf-4aaa-a5dc-0707c1d1bd82"`
uid.title: uid

schemauserEmpty.description: Empty is a message without actual content/body.
schemauserEmpty.title: Empty

namespace.description:
Value of namespace is always "system".

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

tos_accepted.description:
tos accepted version, this field is deprecated refer the fields `tos_accepted_at` and `tos_version` instead.

Example: ` "value"`
tos_accepted.title: tos_accepted

tos_accepted_at.description:
tos accepted timestamp in epoch.

Example: ` "1628490105132"`
tos_accepted_at.title: tos_accepted_at

userAccessType.description:
Used to identify the tenant access

 - UNKNOWN_ACCESS: UNKNOWN_ACCESS

When unable to determine the tenant access
 - DIRECT_ACCESS: DIRECT_ACCESS

Accessing tenant through direct login
 - MSP_ACCESS: MSP_ACCESS

Accessing tenant from MSP tenant
 - DELEGATED_ACCESS: DELEGATED_ACCESS

Accessing tenant from operating tenant through delegated access
 - SUPPORT_ACCESS: SUPPORT_ACCESS

Accessing tenant from support tenant
userAccessType.title: AccessType

userAddonServiceStatus.description:
x-displayName: "Addon Service Status"
displays current state and access of an addon service for the user of tenant.
userAddonServiceStatus.title: AddonServiceStatus

display_name.description:
x-displayName: "Display Name"
Name to use for display purposes
display_name.title: display_name

userAssignRoleRequest.description: Allows assigning user's role in a namespace or set of namespaces.
userAssignRoleRequest.title: Assign role

namespace.description:
Namespace the requesting user is calling the action from

Example: ` "system"`
namespace.title: Namespace

username.description:
Username of the user that needs the role assigned.
 ideally this will be the email address of the user (which is by default treated as username)
 check Create RPC UserRoleRequest for more details.

Example: ` "user1@company.com"`
username.title: Username

userBillingFeatureIndicator.description:
Single instance of a billing indicator.
It informs the customer of any problems with their billing, including failed payments, overdue invoices, or missing valid payment methods.
userBillingFeatureIndicator.title: Billing Feature Indicator

additional_info.description:
Any description (such as error message) related to this billing feature.

Example: ` "payment failed due to insufficient funds"`
additional_info.title: Additional info
additional_info.x-ves-example: payment failed due to insufficient funds

failed.description:
If true then the billing feature is failed and to be looked into.

Example: ` "true"`
failed.title: Failed

userBillingFlag.description:
Possible billing flags used to indicate problems with customer billing.

 - VALID_PAYMENT_METHOD: customer has a valid payment method on our file
 - OVERDUE_INVOICE: customer has at least one overdue invoice with with us
 - LAST_TRANSACTION_STATUS: status of customer's last transaction. a retry may be triggered so this is an early warning.
 - PAYMENT_METHOD_EXPIRED: this flag is on when the customer has no but expired payment method on it's file.
We could not charge your primary payment method due to insufficient funds
Your primary payment method was declined
Security code for your primary payment method is incorrect
ZIP code for your primary payment method is incorrect
We could not charge your primary payment method due to insufficient funds. Your secondary payment method was charged
Your primary payment method has expired. Your secondary payment method was charged
Your primary payment method was declined. Your secondary payment method was charged
We could not charge any of the active payment methods
We could not charge any of the active payment methods
Adding a payment method resulted in an error
userBillingFlag.title: Billing flag

userBillingFlagAction.description:
Action to be executed when customer click on the UI warning

 - NO_ACTION: we don't expect customer to take any actoon
 - ADD_NEW_PAYMENT_METHOD: customer should provide a new payment method
 - CONTACT_US: customer should send us an email
userBillingFlagAction.title: Billing flag action

userCascadeDeleteItemType.description:
CascadeDeleteItemType contains details of object that was handled as part of cascade delete
of user and whether it was successfully deleted
userCascadeDeleteItemType.title: CascadeDeleteItemType
userCascadeDeleteItemType.x-displayname: Cascade Deletion of User and Associated Namespace Roles

error_message.description:
informative error message about the success or failure of the object's deletion response

Example: ` "value"`
error_message.title: error message

object_type.description:
The type of the object

Example: ` "value"`
object_type.title: object's type

object_uid.description:
The uid of the object

Example: ` "value"`
object_uid.title: object's uid

userCascadeDeleteRequest.description:
CascadeDeleteRequest is the request to delete the user along with the associated namespace role objects.
Note: only admin is allowed to delete the user and associated objects.
userCascadeDeleteRequest.title: CascadeDeleteRequest
userCascadeDeleteRequest.x-displayname: Delete the User and Associated Namespace Roles

email.description:
email of the user requesting for

Example: ` "value"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
email.title: email of the user

namespace.description:
Value of namespace is always "system" 

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

userCascadeDeleteResponse.description:
CascadeDeleteResponse contains a list of user objects that were deleted
and possibly any errors when attempting to delete those objects.
userCascadeDeleteResponse.title: CascadeDeleteResponse
userCascadeDeleteResponse.x-displayname: Delete Response for the User and Associated Namespace Roles

delete_ok.description:
status of the deleted objects. 
 "true" value indicates that the operation had been successful for all the objects.
 "false" value indicates that at least one of the delete operations had been unsuccessful.

Example: ` "true"`
delete_ok.title: delete_ok

items.description: The objects deleted for the specific user
items.title: items

userFSMState.description:
States describes possible states for user.

 - StateUndefined: StateUndefined

User state when it was created without any state.
 - StateCreating: StateCreating

User state during initial creation. It includes registering in IDM, creating user-settings object, etc...
 - StateCreateFailed: StateCreateFailed

User state when initial creation was failed by some reason and must be retried
after issue is solved.
 - StateActive: StateActive

User state of completely created and available to use user.
 - StateDisabled: StateDisabled

User is currently disabled, login is not possible for this user, but it may become active again in the future.
userFSMState.title: States

FeatureFlagType
x-displayName: "Feature and its Status for the Tenant's Plan"
userFeatureFlagType.x-displayname: Feature and its Status for the Tenant's Plan

billing_flags.description: Collection of flags informing the customer of any billing related problems, such as overdue invoices.

Example: ` "Teams Plan"`

 User created via signup flow will have this value set to true.
 Few restrictions apply to this user w.r.t role update and deletion.

Example: ` "true"`

email.title: Email

Directly attached namespace roles for the user
 This field is deprecated, refer to namespace_access field for the access of the user.

returns original tenant id that the user belongs if request header exist for original tenant else regular tenant id

tenant will represent id of the tenant that is being accessed

domain_owner.description:
Domain owner is the first user who registered or signed up the associated Tenant.
 User created via signup flow will have this value set to true.
 Few restrictions apply to this user w.r.t role update and deletion.

userIdmType.description:
IdmType is to identify who is managing the user.

 - SSO: SSO User
Externally managed Single Sign On based user imported into UAM.
 - VOLTERRA_MANAGED: F5XC Managed Local user
F5XC managed local user. Full user life cycle is managed by volterra UAM and Identity.
 - UNDEFINED: Undefined
Undefined IDM type
userIdmType.title: IDM Type

disabled.description: If set to true user is completely disabled including IDM.
disabled.title: Disabled

domain_owner.description:
Domain owner is the first user who registered or signed up the associated Tenant.
 User created via signup flow will have this value set to true.
 Few restrictions apply to this user w.r.t role update and deletion.

Example: ` "true"`
domain_owner.title: Domain Owner

tier.title: tier

userMSPNodeType.description:
Managed services node type. This is used to determine if the tenant is a parent or a child or not set at all.

 - MspNodeTypeUnknown: MspUnknown

Managed services status is unknown or not set
 - MspNodeTypeChild: MspChild

Tenant acts as a child for another tenant. In other words, the tenant has a parent tenant that is managing it.
 - MspNodeTypeParent: MspParent

Tenant acts as a parent for another tenant(s). In other words, the tenant has child tenants that are managed by it.
userMSPNodeType.title: Managed services node type

name.description:
This is an optional field meant to be used as username.
 Inside Volterra's UAM, email is already treated as user's username
 and as best practice, recommendation is to keep this same as email field.
 if not specified, this field will be set same as email field.

Example: ` "user1@company.com"`
name.title: Username

namespace.description:
All users of a tenant must be created in tenant's system namespace.

Example: ` "system"`
namespace.title: namespace

namespace_roles.description: List of directly attached roles that the user has for each namespace.
namespace_roles.title: Namespace roles

userUserType.description:
UserType is to identify the type of user

 - USER: User
Regular User
 - SERVICE: Service User
User for accessing only APIs/services
 - DEBUG: Debug
User which was created by tenant admin for volterra-support team.
userUserType.title: UserType
